revised_title: Influence of Nerves on Animal Heat: Additional Experiments
tldr: The author conducted experiments on a deer and a human to study the influence of nerves on animal heat. They found that dividing the nerves of a deer's horn reduced its heat, while obstructing the femoral artery in a human leg did not affect temperature. This demonstrates the importance of nerve function in regulating body heat and provides insights into aneurism treatment.
